title: Net speed impact on browsing
content: I wonder if am living in an area with worst net speed, will mozilla will do it better for a low load website . In short question is whether mozilla or other browsers works good in low net speed conditions?
creator: johnleo185

title: Blocked site
content:
Hello

I am using Firefox 90.0.2 on Windows 10.

It is impossible for me to connect to the website 

    http://www.minresco.com/

Something is blocking it. It is not my ISP (I checked with them; they suggested that either Firefox or antivirus software is doing this).

How do I tell if Firefox is doing the blocking, and how do I remove the block if it is?

Thanks,


Kurt
creator: KurtSO

title: Opening mail and forms
content: I can't open my mail in My Gov (my.gov.au) which is the Australian Government website for Centrelink and the Australian Tax Office. I cannot open forms from Department Main Roads. I have to use Google Chrome to be able to do these things. Is there a way I can fix this?
creator: humphries.mar

title: Most of the Characters Disappearing from Certain Websites
content:
Hey folks!

So ever since yesterday, I have been seeing this issue with certain websites that were earlier working just fine wherein most of the text is not showing up. Please refer to the attached screenshots.

These sites are opening just fine on other browsers though. So I am certain the issue is with Firefox. I have deleted the cache already, and also disabled Hardware Acceleration through the Performance settings.

Still no resolution...
creator: rishabhjain25

title: Fence Icon Above Email Address Box And Warning That Using Real Email Address Might Allow FaceBook to Track
content:
Today is the first time I noticed a red fence icon above the box where I type my email address to login to the website where I do my work as a bookkeeper for a property management company. When I placed my cursor on the icon it said, "If you use your real email address here, Facebook may be able to track you. Click to learn more." See attached screenshot. But, clicking did nothing.

I'm pretty sure I'm safe since the email address I use to login to work is different from the one I use for Facebook, but could someone please shed more light on this?

Thanks! ~Elise
creator: arrowsandspurs

title: Firefox v90 Slow loading if wireless 5G Home network SSiD is changed.
content: I had to purchase a new wireless router. It is recommended to use a new SSiD name on the new router verses the old one to stop issues with IoT devices. If I use a new recommended SSiD name, Firefox v90 takes well over 2 minutes to load. Google Chrome and Edge load instantly. If I do use the old SSiD Firefox loads normally again but I have problems with a bunch of my IoT devices on the network. I have tried setting the loading page to blank, clean installs, refreshing Firefox and playing with other settings in about:config. (Were does Firefox keep tabs of the network name so I can just clear it?) Is it in the registry? Windows 10 Pro 64 PC - New ASUS RT-AX86U router. Any help would be appreciated.
creator: malenart

title: missing text
content: my firefox is for some reason not showing me missing text oncertain websites like news websites and quizziz. in quizziz, you cant read anything as every sentence is gone and only one letter of the sentence is visible. i can see the contents of the cuizziz if i checked from inspect element though like shown in the picture. how do i solve this problem?
creator: Timothyryanjapri

title: Firefox 92.0.2 keeps crashing since upgrade.
content:
Firefox has crashed intermittently since update to 92.0.2. I never had a crash before and have been using it for years.

Adapter Device ID CoffeeLake-S GT2 [UHD Graphics 630] (0x3e91) 

I have updated the Intel Drivers from Intel.

Here are the last 5 crashes.

title: Firefox Nightly Freezes on Opening - Windows 11
content:
Firefox Nightly will freeze on opening in the first instance on Windows 11 about 75% of the time.

I have to open a new instance for it to load. Old instance stays frozen and eventually throws up an error
creator: ben106
